snippet: If you set sweeping goals for the new year, you may well have trouble focusing on how to reach them. But placing smaller goals beneath the larger ones can put you on the right track.
abstract: Eilene Zimmerman Career Couch column points out that if you set sweeping goals for the new year, you may well have trouble focusing on how to reach them; holds that placing smaller goals beneath the larger ones can put you on the right track.
lead_paragraph: If you set sweeping goals for the new year, you may well have trouble focusing on how to reach them. But placing smaller goals beneath the larger ones can put you on the right track.

headline.seo: New Year’s Resolutions at Work, and How to Keep Them
headline.main: To Keep Your Office Resolutions, Start Small
headline.print_headline: To Keep Your Office Resolutions, Start Small
